intro: Impatiens kamerunensis subsp. kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon and neighboring regions of Central Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, which bloom throughout the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for cultivation in tropical and subtropical gardens.
